exec git init
exec git config user.email i@example.com
exec git config user.name someone
exec git checkout -b main

exec git commit -m 'initial commit' --allow-empty
exec git add file
exec git commit -m 'add file'

# Add a new commit that modifies the file
exec sed -i '2 a\inserted' file
exec git add file
exec git commit -m 'modifies file'

# Try to revert the before-last commit, which will conflict.
! exec git revert HEAD~1

exec git status --porcelain --branch
stdout '## main\nUD file'

gitstatus
stdout '&{Porcelain:{NumModified:0 NumConflicts:1 NumUntracked:0 NumStaged:0 IsDetached:false IsInitial:false LocalBranch:main RemoteBranch: AheadCount:0 BehindCount:0} NumStashed:0 HEAD:[a-f0-9]{7} State:Reverting IsClean:false}'
! stderr .

-- file --
line1
line2
